channel.description: Recent content in Reference on Rosie Abe's Data Blog

item.title: data.table - A list of examples I like to reference
item.description: Warning: This is not particularly intended for beginner data.table users Tips and Tricks List: Ordering data by multiple columns using frank() and setorder() Fill NAs in a data.table using set() Writing functions/procedures containing data.tables – Sometimes modifying the input data.table is OK, but be sure you know exactly what you’re doing! What the heck is .I? What the heck is CJ()? I use the data.table package quite a bit at work and it’s become my preferred way to work with data in R, even with smaller data sizes.
